doc:
John Lund (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lund_(actor) 0 John Lund (February 6, 1911 – May 10, 1992) was an American film actor who is probably best remembered for his role in the film A Foreign Affair (1948), directed by Billy Wilder, and a dual role in Mitchell Leisen's To Each His Own (1946). According to one obituary, his "film career was cut to a familiar pattern: the young actor imported to Hollywood after a big success on Broadway begins by playing the handsome guy who gets the girl, then descends by gradual degrees to being the male lead in minor westerns and occasionally, in major films, being the handsome guy who does not get the girl because he lacks the spark of the hero who does." John_Lund ( February_6_,_1911 – May_10_,_1992 ) was an_American_film_actor who is_probably_best_remembered for his_role in the_film A_Foreign_Affair ( 1948 ) , directed by Billy_Wilder , and a_dual_role in Mitchell_Leisen 's_To_Each_His_Own ( 1946 ) . According to one_obituary , his_"_film_career was_cut to a_familiar_pattern : the_young_actor imported to Hollywood after a_big_success on Broadway begins by playing the_handsome_guy who gets the_girl , then descends by gradual_degrees to being the_male_lead in minor_westerns and occasionally , in major_films , being the_handsome_guy who does_not_get the_girl because he lacks the spark of the_hero who does .
